lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hello everyone, and welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: We play Dungeons & Dragons!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, we do!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, okay. Before we get started, we want to give a nice thank you and talk a little bit about our fantastic sponsor for Campaign Two since the very beginning: our friends at D&D Beyond. Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lots of fundraising. I'm waiting for donations from you guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's in process.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's what those envelopes were that I slipped under your chairs.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thought that was a parking ticket.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those are not tax-deductible. I'm pleased to announce today that I have an opponent. A big part of running for office is to have an opponent and to know who you're facing. A lot of nominations came in, a lot of suggestions. Some people couldn't do it. Marisha was actually technically too young to run. Taliesin, not a citizen of the United States. Also not sure where he is a citizen of.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a country that doesn't exist anymore.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yep, that's about right. Travis didn't pass the IQ test. So what we're left with was the opponent that will be running against me for the presidency of D&D Beyond is: (drumroll)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, is that a drumroll?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Liam O'Brien!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, man.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're friends, so I hope we run a respectful campaign.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The word is frenemies.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I've been doing this for a while. I got Dani Carr as my campaign manager. I've got it going on. So I don't know what you've got in store for this campaign, but it's not going to be all that. But whatever. I'll give you the floor. Let's see what you got.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're quick-witted. You're clever. You're good in bed, but this is the adults' table. Roll the motherfucking clip!

lines.name: NARRATOR
lines.text: (VO) And now a message from Liam O'Brien.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (VO) I'm Sam Riegel's husband and I approve this message.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, wow. I mean, that's just--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I leave it up to the people to decide.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you remember what I said about a respectful campaign? Fuck that, the gloves are off, motherfucker, you're going down. I will rule D&D Beyond! Back to you, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam. Thank you, Liam.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll settle it in the bedroom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So tune in to the Critical Role Twitch channel at 7:00 pm Pacific to watch it. If you miss the live broadcast, you can check out the VOD on Saturday at youtube.com/criticalrole. Travis, you've got something-- Not Travis, Laura, actually.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi, I'm Laura!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's you! You're Laura. You're Travis.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So just a reminder, the preorders for our amazing Mighty Nein and Vox Machina art prints, those end tonight at 11:59. That's signed and unsigned, go to the store if you want them because once they're gone, they're gone. Also, speaking of once they're gone, they're gone: I've got one more thing that I want to tell you about. Which is--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Witches.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So at our live show for The Search for Grog, we had posters for sale for The Search for Grog. And we thought we sold out of them but then we found an extra box, so we're putting them in the store.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh cool!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: These are in the store right now. There's not a whole lot of them, so if you grab one, go to the store right now and you can find them. Once they're gone, they're gone for real, because there's no more.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't have one of those!

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: Ed!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We will grab some out of the box before they go to the store.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, the people need them more than us. We can photocopy, it's fine.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a need.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So yeah, in honor of The Search for Grog. That's my announcement. Travis! Do you have an announcement?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There, Travis--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! I should say, though, I should definitely say the art is by Hugo--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: @takayuuki_art

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: @takayuuki_art, and it's so beautiful, I'm not showing-- Okay, I'm stopping. Get away from me, camera. Travis?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just let it sink in. Let it sink into your body. Let it get in through your skin and your meat and your bones. There will be more details to share leading up to launch day, but since you cracked it so fast we just had to let y'all know what's going down. So get hype. (singing) Get hype. Get hype.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Animated. An-animated.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do it for cartoons, I dance for cartoons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughing) Dance for cartoons!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And I believe that is the end of our announcements for the evening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do we still get to play D&D on this show?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (goofy voice) Uh, Liam? I believe that's what we're doing next.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [water bubbling] [thunder] [explosion] (chanting) Role! Critical! Role! [dramatic Critical Role theme]

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Villains beware 'cause you're about to be dead.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) They got magic and flair, they got falchions and cunning. They don't see over there there's a monster incoming. Inspiration is waiting, rise up, don't think twice. Put your fate in your hands, take a chance, roll the dice! (chanting) Role! Critical! Role!

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Can you answer the call? Diggin' deep in your soul as the legend unfolds. Now it's your turn to roll! [fire burning] (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's the balance of rational--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I just tied-in a job I had earlier today.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was with you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: and some good rope work. I'm sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't need to do that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's a mage in Rexxentrum.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance around the gray field dotted with clusters of leafless trees and brush and look to the nearby city of Asarius. What would you like to do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: When he doesn't start with, "What do you want to do," I get nervous!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know! What do we want to, I have no idea what we want to do!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Has our bugbear friend already taken off?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The heavy snoring, and somewhat sore movement of his body once he gently comes to consciousness, belays the recovery period from the encounter the day before. He has not left.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hello, Gluzzo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hello to you, too."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good morning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Good morning."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Doesn't he have to rewrap the tattoo every day or something for infections?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: A little bit of coconut oil.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Aquaphor.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh really? I haven't told anyone to do that. I mean, I've never gotten a tattoo, I've only given them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't have

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You never practice on yourself?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, why would I do that? I have other people, you know?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's all right. You treat it like any other wound." He grabs some mud and dirt from the ground, and jams it into the space there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (groans and pained reactions)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to get some breakfast going, we'll have a moment, we'll fill our bellies, and then we'll figure out what we're going to do.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The conundrum at hand is that some of us don't look like monsters, right?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, that is a problem, apparently. How do we fix that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It will be slow going, I don't think we can do anything that will last more than a short while. I can change my own appearance. I can change Beauregard's appearance.

lines.name: MARISHA, SAM
lines.text: You can?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I know how to. Roughly an hour of time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, you're telling me this

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is this a new ability?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, it is!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's always learning and growing as a wizard! It's what I love about him most.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How did you even find this one? That's really cool, Caleb!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long have you known?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Not long at all.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It still baffles me that anyone can't do this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have been working on it, because, you know, what you are hoping for.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like what? To changing back and stuff?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I didn't know that you were aware. I mean, I don't want to stand in the way of your growth and journey and your path. I mean, if you stumbled upon a way to, you know, make me whole again, I wouldn't say no to it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What I'm able to do is limited. It's not what you want, but it's a start.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: How long does it last?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roughly an hour.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Same for me. I can re-up it every once in a while.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think you look just fine. That's the sense I get.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You look over at Gluzzo and he's not even paying attention to the conversation.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (louder) That's the sense I get.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What's the-- What?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fjord, is probably going to be, not necessarily welcomed with open arms, but he's not going to draw any odd glances or anything in this town of yours?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's tiny for an orc, but he should be okay."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, no, I've worked out. I have--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're very big. You're very large and stuff.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Fun-sized.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "He's pretty small."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it's a really good size that you have.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe I'll make myself a little bit larger.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe you do seem bigger when you're on a ship, an enclosed area.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Where do you clock in, about 6'1" or--?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, ish. Okay. Let's stop talking about me. Maybe, if we figure out exactly what we need in the city, we'll understand how long we actually need to be in there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We need to go into the city to get some sort of conveyance, right? Some sort of animal or vehicle to take us further in our journey.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, yeah, that'd make it faster. Otherwise it's, what, two weeks?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a long time, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Boy. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we need anything else? Weapons? Allies?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Just go shopping. Books, maybe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Would they have books in monster land?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Some dresses and stuff.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dresses?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I like dresses. I thought we could look for some. I bet the ones here look a lot different than the ones in Nicodranas, so I thought it could be fun to go shopping.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Undoubtedly, but we are going to need to pick our moments for adjusting Beauregard and Yasha's appearance. It's not game on all day, like we're in Zadash where we can go shopping for things. If we see something, if it presents itself, then we could, but we need to be careful.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We do have manacles. We could make them our prisoner.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That might attract attention, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could throw a bag over someone's head and drag them into an alley--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Punch them every once in a while.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm standing right here!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I think I could.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, I can change something into another animal, so I can't imagine I can't change her into another person, do you think?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How long does that last?

lines.name: LAURA, LIAM
lines.text: Roughly an hour.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's Polymorph. It's an hour. I mean, yeah, you can do that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it weird?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not weird. Polymorph is, you can turn into anything, so if you want to turn into a different person? Totally, by all means.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's a bazooka, is what he's saying.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Use the thing that can make you a dragon into somebody who looks different.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, basically. Yeah, totally.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Does Yasha-- Yasha? Who's Yasha today?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She's still laying down and looking up at the sky.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you fit in here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I haven't been this far north, but I mean, if someone gets in my face, I'll punch them."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we were going to Polymorph anybody, I would recommend Mr. Caleb, since I imagine we would want physical people to feel comfortable in themselves. I guess a lot of you is up here?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's basically all up there. I was thinking that I would change my appearance.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, that's fair too. That's probably a better plan.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, and you could be whatever you want to be.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it change my clothes? I feel like my blue vestiges really say Empire.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can change your entire appearance and your physical being for roughly one hour.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Dope.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Gluzzo, are there any codewords or sayings in your city? Any greetings or things that people exchange that would be familiar to someone that lives there?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Not really. It's more of a heavy grunt."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: A heavy grunt?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (grunt)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (grunt)

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: (grunting back and forth)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's not too bad. That'll probably work for some people, yeah."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Having been in the city so long, anything ever make outsiders very obvious to your eye, or ear, when they come in?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I go out and hunt things, and bring them back, and "work for my boss. That's about it."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're hoping to go in, do a little commerce, and get out without causing a ruckus, is all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Then don't cause a ruckus."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Then if they see human-ish people-ish, how big of a problem, if we do run into something, do you think that'd be? That's fair.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are not going to cause a ruckus. I would ask of you, Gluzzo, are you going to cause a ruckus?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm a fan of how much we're using the word "ruckus."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We should get a ruckus room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Look, I'm going to be honest. You people have not done anything bad to me, and you don't "seem to be the typical Empire types. As long as you don't go shouting that you're from the Empire, "maybe you'll be okay."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I toss him one more gold.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that money bad? Is that bad money? Does it also scream Empire?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, I mean, gold is gold. Not everyone takes it. A lot of the city tends to be barter for "work, but some do take gold."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If you escort us into the city safely and see us to the outskirts when our business is done, there will be another 20 for you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "How about this? When we get to the city, I just never see you again." (laughter)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Barter.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I will give you ten gold to make sure that that happens. Just take it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll take it, okay. Very good deal." He gets up, (stretching). "Well, shall we?"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, let's do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, are you going to--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Transport, potions, weapons, things like that. Maybe books, if there are such things.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Should we split up or stick together?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Stick together.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Stick together in a totally obvious group.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we have any means, if we do get split up, do we know where we're meeting? Because we don't know anything about this city. Are there any-- Gluzzo. Are there any places in the city that are easy to spot? Tower spires, anything that we can--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're right outside the city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, the city's got a wall around it, and there's watchtowers. There's the Aurora Hold in "the middle. It's the big gray tower piece. That's where all the Kryn use as their base of operations."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's maybe meet at the wall and not the center of the city. That seems a little--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Either way. There are places of business, if that's what you're looking for."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I guess that's-- yeah. Before we leave, does anyone want to take a, uh-huh, out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A gander at the thing?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: While you guys do that, can I talk to Gluzzo? I'm going to take the haversack off and pass it to whoever wants it. Don't take it out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. Who wants it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm holding it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll take it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I feel like Beau should have it, for some reason, some dreadful reason.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I might get in a ruckus.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Don't get in a--!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to try to avoid ruckuses.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hey, Gluzzo. Can I take him aside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's standing tall now, once again. Even with a slight hunch, he's still close to seven feet. Him and Caduceus are in a similar range, with a similar hunch, but his ears are a little wider out there. A lot heavier fur. He's pleasantly dopey.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Gluzzo.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you tell me about the Light that you pray to, please?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, are you familiar with the Luxon?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes, I have heard a little bit about it, but I was wondering what you could tell me about it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "To be perfectly honest, I don't know all that much. The darker elves tell us of great "possible things if we work together as a community. Since I've grown up, it was always "about the Luxon, as a place to come to, and--"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Place to come to?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "There is a place to worship in the city, yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What does it look like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It looks sort of like--" He pulls out his necklace. Those who are paying attention, you can see across the chain a small, wire-frame dodecahedron made of rough metal. He goes, "The Luxon, they say, is the first and the original god of Exandria. If we work hard together and we "stay pious towards the light, then maybe one day we, too, will be reborn."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right. Because that would be really cool, to be reborn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah. Especially," he points back, "since my line of work is not all that safe. Anyway."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: To the light, and stuff! Also the Traveler.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay!" He starts walking towards the city.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god, their god is our thing!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the bugbear god the same as the Kryn?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did you say, "to the light"?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He prays to a thing that looks like our thing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We have their god in our haversack?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, I think we have a holy relic or something!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The Luxon, right? That's what I heard.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Luxon.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I've told you about this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've told us about the Luxon?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That ring any bells?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll a religion check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was hoping you'd say that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We thought it was a different Luxor.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Seven.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Other than-- at that roll, you barely remember that Caleb mentioned it a couple of times. You're like, oh, oh yeah. That's as much as you know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's generous of you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have their holy relic in addition to the relic that can maybe--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Amplify it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also give them children? I mean, this is--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know about that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think the children, what if-- (gasps) Oh my god! What if, when people die, their soul gets trapped inside of this thing? Until it's returned, new souls can't go into new babies, and so no babies can be born and stuff? What if we're keeping all of the souls with us?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What if our souls get trapped in it, and we're stuck in there for thousands of years? I don't want to be a baby again! Being a baby sucked!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no, you're getting younger right now!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Shit!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think that we are still in a wait-and-see moment here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think we've used it a fair number of times and nobody's turned into a wee

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm not saying you turn into a baby.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Beau is saying that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That is what Beau is saying.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I don't want to be reincarnated as a baby. Reincarnate me as a tiefling or a dwarf or something.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry, Beau, just going to say, too soon for the whole Reincarnate business.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I didn't mean to spit on you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How does that work, though? Can I ask a question, though?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How did it work? Did you come back as already a functional person? Or did you come back as a baby goblin?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I came back as what you see here, minus a year or two. I was a full-grown goblin.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where did this body come from, you know what I mean? Was it somebody else's, or did it appear magically or something? I don't understand.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This body bleeds, so it's not some sort of-- it wasn't built by a man.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe you were a baby and you don't remember it. Most people don't remember when they're babies. I mean, I do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but then they remember when they're, like, four.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like we're getting to the root of something with you that I really want to explore later. I'm not sure what it is yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't think I was ever a baby because, if I were a baby, and I grew up to be a goblin adult, my son would be ten, 12 years, right now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, Flight of the Navigator.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I did just stare at this relic in front of Gluzzo.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He didn't see it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that super insensitive, though?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It looked like your head was in the bag. It probably looked like you were eating some trail mix or something.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He doesn't strike me as a high, holy, learnéd man of the cloth, if it is even a traditional religion. From what I have read, people here, the Kryn, used to worship a different god, I don't know how long ago. Lolth.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lolth? I can tell why they stopped worshipping that one.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This light and darkness.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's responsible for the dunamancy? Dunamis?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Possibly connected.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there anyone heading out of the city in our direction, now that we've spent some time?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check. First off, Gluzzo is about 90 feet from you, walking towards the city.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh! We should probably catch up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He started walking, and you guys kept talking, and he kept walking.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we disguise ourselves?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think, for maximum time, we should-- everyone pull up your hoods, and let's get closer to the city. Otherwise we are going to burn through 20 or 30 minutes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Fair enough. Well, let's see who's on the road.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking ahead, best you can see, there's a low fog that permeates a lot of the field in front of you this early in the morning, based on the recent rains that have happened. You don't see anyone. You're not close enough to draw attention, but there's a lot of activity around the city, though it's too far to really make out the fine details. You do see, now in the daylight, some sort of a perimeter wall. Looks to be a gray or purple hue; it's hard to really tell from this distance. You can see watchtowers scattered along the outskirts a little bit. You can vaguely see one one spire, loosely central to the entire shape of the city's skyline. There's a bunch of things gathered around the outside of the wall. You'll probably have to get closer to make out more detail.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not a ton of traffic on the road coming in and out just yet?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hard to tell from this distance. There are no roads leading to you; you guys are out in the middle of the field.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Huge-ass traps and delts, and my clothes don’t quite fit right anymore. Rippling-ass muscles, and I'm--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought that you already were jacked?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I'm fucking jacked. Fjord--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're shredded.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I have to turn like this.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Never stretched a day in your life.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's got skinny chicken legs, but super big--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I've got to run I'm like (awkward galloping).

lines.name: LIAM, LAURA
lines.text: Always skip leg day.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It only gets in the way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to use Disguise Self to make myself look like me, only super goth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Goth Jester.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Definitely black fingernails and tattoos and stuff.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Yasha reaches down and gets some mud and smears it down her face. You see these finger lines across the front. Musses up the outside so she looks like she's been wandering and hunting alone in the wild for a while.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll play with that. I'm going to scar myself up, and emaciate, and let everything get a little craggly. A little more Dark Crystal-y on the wrong end.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, nice!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How do you want to do this?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you make me a dude tiefling? A red, shifty-looking tiefling? Red skin, deep eyes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Deep, what color eyes?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Crazy eyes, like you're demonstrating for me right now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, like that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You can't change your voice, now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What, you don't think I sound like a dude?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Kind of. Yeah, no. You're good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Give me a dude physique that would match this.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay, so I pull out a small caterpillar's cocoon, and I start muttering some arcane words over it. I waft it in front of your face, and then poof. She is a, poof.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. You are a red tiefling. It's pretty accurate as you can envision, at least what you can see of yourself. You don't really have any reflective surface to check, but based on this, not bad.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I check my pants.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Long may he reign indeed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Holy shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's only seen one dude's tiefling.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why is just my dick purple? I don't understand. There's a gradient.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's just a sunny-side up egg.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My happy trail has an ombre. This is incredible!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The benefits of the tiefling.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Long and wide may he reign!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Given that there's a time limit on the duration of these spells, a little hustle probably wouldn't hurt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys pick up the pace a bit, jogging through the muddy fields. (squelching) Your boots are occasionally getting caught for a moment, but you manage to maintain a decent pace heading towards Asarius. You catch up to Gluzzo who goes, "All right, we're running! Okay!" And he keeps up with you bounding alongside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's still us. We just went through the Saint's Row character creation.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. Basically.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like that we now have MC Christ and Gerard Way at the table. It's all I really needed.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is our version of Monster Factory. Much love to the brothers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: By the way, Matt, side note: this music is fucking awesome! Whatever you're doing? Amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Blizzard, for giving us approval to use Diablo music.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, tight!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Thanks, Blizzard.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Thanks, Blizz.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: For the light.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughing) For the light.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you're continuing to move towards the city looking at this display, you see a group of gnolls together tugging on these heavy leather straps at the base of one of these mounds and you watch as it shifts, mud and dirt tumbling from the sides revealing four hut-sized, thick trunks of legs from underneath. A colossal war tortoise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: From this distance, you can only guess 60 to 80 feet from end to end on this shell. (heavy footsteps)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What the fuck is that?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a war tortoise, man. It's a war tortoise. War tortoise.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we trade The Mistake for that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're stalking around the wastes and the surrounding grounds. Heavy iron chains wrapped like a harness across their 20-foot wide torso each mounted by an armored Kryn who's rocking back and forth with each impact of its huge tree trunk-like limbs dragging itself through the muck and mud. You can see squat legs dragging it forward as its limbs pull it forward like a heavy gorilla. All covered in a dark gray-brown fur that's matted with mud and grime. The face of the creature, which you see for the first time now that it's getting close enough, rests between the shoulders without neck or really a head. Just embedded between where the shoulders are as part of the torso. A gray, scaled, leathery brow that folds around four red eyes the size of cannonballs arranged much like a spider's face and a tangle of teeth and tusks that protrude from a frighteningly wide mouth that almost leads from shoulder to shoulder at the very front. (stomping) As it shifts forward, one of the mouths opens and you see this large, heavy, thick tongue pull off and scrape against the tusks and then withdraw into the mouth and the jaw closes shut. You can feel on the ground with each heavy limb fall (stomping).

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Those are in the city or outside?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is outside the city.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roughly how tall?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That creature is probably about 30 feet at the top of its height. Shoulder height.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But 20 feet wide.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The shoulders are about 20 feet wide side to side. If you're to look at it head on like 20, 25 feet right there. The shoulders themselves are about 20 feet apart and from the top when it's fully stood up, you imagine it'd probably get up to about 25 or 30 feet, but it tends to be a little hunched as it pulls forward.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know when you go to that area in the game and you're not quite leveled up for it yet?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Mm-hmm, and you run the other way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes. You guys, not to be pessimistic or anything, but I think their army is way cooler than the army that we've seen.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Mm-hmm. For sure.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should all just hang out and be part of Xhorhas from now on. I mean, they're pretty cool.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They are pretty cool.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They've got moving hills. They've got these giant spider weird guys.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want a war turtle.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The tortoises are crazy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have not tasted the food here yet. Maybe let's just reserve judgment for--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we have Caduceus.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I feel like we're gilding an awful lot of expectations at the moment. I'd really like to get a better sense of these people before we--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Decide to live here?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Even decide how we feel about it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Roughly 51 more minutes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, let's go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, this might be like... You know when you go to Hawaii and you're like: why don't we live here?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 50 minutes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You push on and Gluzzo is jogging alongside you and keeping his head down. You guys approach the southeast gates. Each side is about ten feet wide, maybe 15 feet tall. It actually crawls up higher than the rest of the surrounding wall and has a slight arch to it. One of them is closed the other is partially open. You can see some soldiers are coming in and out. Other people that are working the field start exchanging directions and that would be the nearest entrance-- pardon-- to the city.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Does it look like there are people blocking the entrance? Like they're heavily guarded?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No one blocking the entrance, but you do see on each side of it two very large and armored ogres. Both holding heavy clubs with an axe blade on each side. They're just there looking out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are people that are coming and going are they wearing anything identifying? Any kind of medals, badges, pins, ribbons?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The people who are coming and going, are the ogres stopping them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19? Nothing that you can really make out, unfortunately. I mean, their outfits aren't uniform. Everything is very patchwork and scavenged or put together to, at least from what you've seen, to be utilitarian. There's no decor. As you approach this heavy gate, you can see one of the ogres looks to you all and (growling breaths).

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: (grunt)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we just walk with confidence?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's leading the charge in to the city?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I am.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a deception check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's just like we're sneaking into an E3 party. Here we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Done that a thousand times.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, look like you belong. Look like you belong, no one will stop you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, we've all had to sneak into our own game parties before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He doesn't pay attention. He doesn't notice. You all weasel past through the six-foot space of the right hand door that's open, and enter Asarius.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We're in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: City of Beasts.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Burly ogres clutching barrels and beams. You can see orcs that are dragging hunted quarry behind them through the mud or over their shoulders some of them still struggling, not quite dead from the wounds they sustained before an orc just takes it and slams it across its back so it goes to stillness and stops moving. Not a lot of conversation, but occasional bickering and growling at each other. There is still a civilized sense of order to this. More than you would have assumed based on the interactions you've had with gnolls and other such creatures who seem to live in these spaces. Goblins especially. And you do see goblins. You do see goblins and goblin-kin children rushing through the alleys and scurrying off into the roads. Clusters of them carrying something together. Some of them just trying to wait for something to drop or be left or forgotten from one of the larger folk and then just scavenged and taken away.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Definitely keeping hands on pockets and pouches.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm keeping an eye out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you give Jester back the haversack or are you--?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, I did.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Part of my disguise it looks black with my disguise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But the majority of the people you see that are spread throughout the city are furred bugbears, scruffy gnolls, anxious kobolds, actually, and the occasional minotaur.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (gasp)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Everyone stops and gives wide berth as it walks through across the street.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The whole table just turned into the horny and aroused meme.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm into this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He was beautiful.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continues down the street in loosely the direction that you're traveling, but a good 20, 30 feet ahead of you and then continues if you wanted to keep pace or just wait.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He had a posse?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A posse of roughly 11 or 12 Kryn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are just around him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Around him, yeah. You get the sense that he has some sort of importance or station in this location.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. I was going to say that's a guard.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You've probably got to work hard to keep that clean.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we want to follow? Now that we're in, is there anything that is discernible to the eye? Like a weapons store--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gluzzo's just walking away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, okay. He can just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He doesn't acknowledge. You're in the city and he just walks away.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we see anything like a blacksmithy or a weapons store or--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Livestock?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, that's everywhere. That's going to be hard to pinpoint a place.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can start to look around.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's probably animals.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can ask around.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't want to make a lot of-- I don't want to hit up a lot of contact just yet and see what we can see.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and make a general investigation check. Oh, if you're not asking around, then it would just be perception.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not bad, though; it's 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Possibly feral, it's hard to tell, but they have an eye about them like they've been through enough to survive amongst these people in the wastes and this city. You get a sense of why Yasha put herself into a little bit of that rough and tumble presentation before you entered.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do they have the look of, say, beaten, fearful slaves or rough--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good call.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (growling) Balls.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe if you had more, you know, space in that dice tray.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't get a sense of any sort of enslaved or subjugated aspect. They just seem to be another surviving member of the community who, because they are human and the nature of the war and the kind of people that exist in this space, has had to undergo some rough hazing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Prison rules.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, kind of.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is anyone wearing the symbol? The Lux? The Luxor?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, good call.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not great. Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell. There's a lot of movement, and a lot of armor, and a lot of fur, and a lot of other types. You don't see anyone who very overtly is showing off any sort of iconography or jewelry that would be similar to what you saw on Gluzzo.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Aside from the minotaur and the army, is there any type of guards? Any type of--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The watchtowers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't see any noted guard. You don't see anybody who seems to be uniformed or have any sort of an identifiable attire or imagery that would give you the idea that there was a wandering guard, yet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The watchtowers seem like they're probably for siege attacks, for army? They don't seem to have anybody posted in them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They do have people posted in them. You don't know if that's because it is wartime, or that it's part of the watch over the city, or both. You're uncertain.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe you covered this and my player missed it, but do the Kryns seem to be an occupying force or part of--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why does it sound like you say Koreans?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Because it sounds like he's saying Koreans.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, he says "Krin."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I say "Kreen."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you say "Kor-een," so it sounds like you're saying--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I believe I said "Krin" last game, Laura Bailey. This time I tried to match the dungeon master, but I am playing with a German accent and sometimes strange things happen. You should have heard the things I had to say in a German accent earlier today. It was this whole scene, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Twins, twins, please. Please.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aww.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Occupying force or integrated with society?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make an insight check for me.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Give me a good roll. It's cocked, right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because you have a thousand dice around it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It was the same roll. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's hard to tell. There doesn't seem to be any fear of the Kryn as they walk around, but they don't seem to be fully integrated and rubbing shoulders with the roughnecks of the city. You don't sense any sort of tension that would normally be part of an occupying force.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm of the mind that we should follow the big minotaur. I mean, he could only be going to and from places of importance.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did we see where he went?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, he's still walking ahead of you guys with a brisk pace. There's some distance growing between the two of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, we'll keep 20 to 30 feet behind.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought we were trying to get beasts to ride.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking around, the structures of this building are varied and patchwork, with huts and hovels mingling with mud-brick buildings and domes, and small, roughly-hewn and sculpted domiciles. You pass one of the dormant tortoises that you saw that's actually in the city. It's sitting there occupying a lot in this city. Atop its back, you see a goblin neighborhood of dense shacks and dwellings, clustered, built, and strapped onto its back. You can see--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Get the fuck out of here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's so fucking cool!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did it crawl into the city because it could move?! The whole city can move?!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yes, it the turtle still alive?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can't tell. All you see is the shell there and this goblin neighborhood built atop its shell that's strapped and pressed onto it. You can see all these clustered tents and huts and pieces of gathered and scavenged woods that have been pressed together to create this small shantytown atop this tortoise shell. There you can see a few goblins out there that are doing repairs, a few that are--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was going to say, cruise ships are the worst.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This goblin's like (angry muttering) and trying to stretch it out more and breathe hot on it. It's not really doing anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nott! Did you live on a turtle?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I did not live on a turtle. I've never seen anything like that. That's

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is way cooler than what you had.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes. Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I really feel like we should invest in a turtle. It seems so useful.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The maintenance, though. If you own a turtle, you have to fix everything on it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true. What if you rent the turtle, is that--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Leasing is really the way to go.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, lease it. Get the newest turtle.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a business expense.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys pass the small goblin neighborhood to your right, you hear the familiar barks that had echoed from the army earlier. You pass a preserve/livery for those panther-like beasts. You can see a numerous number of these kept in this large pen. They have these chain collars around their neck, and they're all tethered to a central, heavy pole that's currently pressed deep into the mud. There are some of them that are lying and sleeping; some of them are hungrily pacing on the outside of the pen, looking at the passersby and growling. Getting a better look at it, you can see they have this wonderfully aerodynamic profile to them. Their head and neck are sloped all the way past their shoulders to the back. Basically, it isn't until the hind haunches that the curvature ends. What it is is this super slick, matted, thick, heavy, wiry fur that itself is a dull gray-purple color. It seems matted at the top, and then it tends to fluff out a bit once you get past where the shoulders and the pits are of its appendages. It's very panther-like in its physicality, just more muscular and lean and stretched. A little more exaggerated in its feline figure, aside from the fact that its head is this continuous, muscled neck into a sloped, toothy mouth at the front. You can see on the sides these two large, bulging, almost creepily fish-like eyes that are lidless and poke out the sides of the head, looking out in both directions. In the front, there is not a classic cat nose, but it looks almost like a cat skull, but flesh pulled over it. It has these two open slits that are long in the front. Its jaw hangs open with these two large tusks that curl up in the front, and its tongue dangles out the front. (panting)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can they blep? That's the important thing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll have to find out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: With the fish-eye blep. That would be so cute.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've only seen these creatures on their own? They're not carrying anything, and they don't have saddles of any sort?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I thought they were armored up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: These ones do not. The ones that you saw outside in the army were.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Were armored, but didn't have people riding on them?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They were saddled up. They didn't have people on them at the time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, they were saddled up?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could ride them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are going to Skeletor this shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not terrible, but they love their mud, and this is a good space for them. You can see one pen that has these giant aurochs that are being kept as beasts of burden that are penned into each other into a small space. There's a portion of the ground where more of those roots-- similar to those large fields you saw being cultivated on the outside of the city-- there's a smaller version of it being placed here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) What's an auroch?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's an ox.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, a massive ox. Big, heavy, bison-type fur wreath around its head, huge horns. These in particular, you would gather, probably pull a lot of the heavy equipment and, from base to shoulder, probably stand about eight feet tall.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Big yak.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we go talk to the livery folk?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, can we ride these thingies with the fish eyes?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I go knock on the turtle shell and see if the turtle's still alive?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let the tortoise thing go for a little bit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The turtle shell's not connected to the livery, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Some pay no mind; some do give a curious look because you're certainly not a troop of mostly beast-looking folk. They don't seem to stop you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Caleb noted the time when they cast their spells. Would his keen mind tell them how much is left?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this time, I'd say you have between 25 and 20 minutes left of those spells, in the time that it's taken you to walk to the city and then make your way this far inside, keeping an eye for various details around you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What if we split? What if we acquire some transport from the people that don't have the fear of changing back? The others can make their way out of the city, and we'll meet you there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or! We've seen some humans around here, they're just scummy. You could just muck up your face and fit in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or we just fucking recast the spell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Just let us know when we're running out of time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm just saying, if we're going to be here for longer than two hours and we don't want to keep recasting, we could maybe see if--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We could just beat the shit out of Beau and we'll be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm so down to be scummy.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We were going to get something to ride, and leave.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caduceus. While they're having this conversation, you're looking around the space, and you look back and that big minotaur that you guys were following is now walking straight towards you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, god!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What do you mean? Oh, god!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't want to be here!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You guys don't know anything yet. We've got company.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go see if there's someone working at the livery. Is there a hut?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's the large pen, and there is a 40-foot-wide structure; rough, thatched roof that's been treated with some sort of a heavy muck and/or possibly creature mucus to give it a shiny, rain-proof exterior. The front has a door. It's a rough-looking door, that's rounded at the top and doesn't fit properly into the entire entryway, but it seems functional. Do you walk towards the livery?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, that's why we're here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm staring at the minotaur.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys move towards the livery, he curves and follows. He's beelining towards you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mm-hmm. I'm going to acknowledge with a bow, once I notice that he's moving towards us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to smile and then remember that I'm goth and go--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's much better.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He approaches. Only two of the Kryn soldiers that were with him are now at his sides; the rest have gone inside the Aurora Hold, which seems to have been his destination until someone had taken note.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I wish we had planned out a story before we came in here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. I mean, yep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Maybe a little bit taller, but much wider, and burly. As soon as his final hoof-fall hits the mud--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, I'm feeling the physical aggression?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just a presence.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll give it to him. I'll get a little shorter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I must admit I have not seen you within this city before."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is our first time here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So color me curious. What is your business, and whom do you serve?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: May I, or do you want to? Our business is we're looking to collect some transport, maybe do a little trade while we're in town, and head on our way. As to our service, we are private contractors on what I will say, of the many missions that we've put forward, is one of our truer, more noble missions at this point.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Contractors? What is your business?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Whatever we're being contracted for. At this point, just--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sellswords?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sometimes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Smugglers.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sometimes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "From where do you hail?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Everywhere.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All over, really.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nogvurot, for me, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I need you both to make deception checks.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that deception?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're definitely not from all over. You're from one place.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's fair. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Looks squarely at each of you as you say this, and turns the nose up a bit and gives a very brief nod. You hear the plates of the metal creaking as he shifts the weight from one hoof to the other.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is beautiful, by the way, I've never seen anything like it before.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And you never will. Handmade."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Gorgeous.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: By who? A really powerful artisan master smith and stuff?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're gothing. You're gothing real good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going on gothing as I'm doing it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She's not moving her jaw.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It was crafted from a sister of my house in celebration of my near-umavi ascension."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Near-umavi ascension?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're definitely not from around here, are you?"

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very much not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would say talk to Lady Zethriss Olios within the "Aurora Hold if you are looking for contracted work."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Say that name again?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Zethriss Olios."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is very generous of you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm sorry. Forgive our impertinence, we didn't ask for your name.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gives you a look like-- you can see in the way the head turns like, you don't know my name? He goes, "I have had many names through many lives, but the one I take now is Sunbreaker Oloman."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sunbreaker Olman?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oloman.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Almond.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And is there a Mrs. Sunbreaker, or--?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you flirting with the fucking minotaur?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (shocked laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow! We've been sending him messages every night.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Risking our lives behind enemy lines.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The massive minotaur looks down at the goblin with a curled eyebrow and goes, "Heh. No."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, don't make any messes," and he turns around.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Pleasure. I like it here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did you see the way? I think he winked at you. I think I saw--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I couldn't tell--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I thought he winked at me, but that's fine.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: -- through his piercing eyes.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Those were his horns, were piercing. His horns, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. He was horny.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Stay on task.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Sorry. I'm sorry.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How much time, Keen Mind?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: About 15 to 20?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point, about 15 minutes or so before it--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's head into the liv--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Livery.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Livery and see if there's a conversation.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What was his name? Oloman.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Olman? Olmin?

lines.name: MATT, LAURA
lines.text: Oloman.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Anyway.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Saddle up! (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS, SAM
lines.text: Like a gerbil on a banana.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Once again, Sam has ruined tomorrow morning's Twitter.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: DM's as red as his t-shirt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a combination of the fur, the dung, and this heavy, acrid smell that you can only attribute to--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Cat piss.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Bulbous chin. Looks like Meg Mucklebones from Legend, but much smaller and a dude.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: "Older in his years," does that mean he's like 15, 16?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (oohing)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He's seen some shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The long, dirty toenails haven't been clipped in a while, and hook over the front of the toes. You can see him reaching up with one leg, and finishes wrapping a rope around some pole leaning on the edge. He turns the rest of you and goes, "Hello, there! You coming to do business, eh?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're on fire tonight. Hello, old timer!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, hi there, little girl! Nice to see you!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Pleasant day we're having here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Quite pleasant indeed!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you manage these stables here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Aye, welcome to Zorth's Pits! I'm Zorth."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Zorth?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah!"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Zorth.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Zorth's pit?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Family business? Are these your kin?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No! They're a bunch of pissants!" And they kind of (goblin yelping) scatter. One of them starts carefully stepping into the pen with a cluster of maybe not-the-freshest meat but is standing before them and tossing them. You hear (snarling) and immediately the goblin runs outside. Looks back at the rest of you, "Here we got the best beasts in the land. You looking to "buy something, huh?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (stuttering) We are. Or at least rent. Lease? Borrow?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Loan, maybe.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, we've been taking a look at your stock here. I'm from the south of Xhorhas, so I'm not familiar with the animals up here. The...?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Moorbounders!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maulbounders?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Moorbounders!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Moorbounders. That's the longer, panther-like?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, they're from the swamps in the south."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's why I was familiar with them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's where you said you were from. You don't know what they are?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we call them something different down there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "What do you call them?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We call them... swamp panthers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not very imaginative. And not accurate either.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. No, well that's why--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Who am I to judge? A nice young lady coming in here to do some business. Now I'm not going to "lie, these aren't cheap. And looking at the bunch of you, I don't know if they're in your wheelhouse "to afford it. But you know? Let's give it a try anyway. What are you looking for? How many you "looking to buy, huh?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many would we need? Can each one carry more than one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well if you're included, then you'll probably fit three on one of them. For the average "sized folk-- Oh, look at this big fellow right here! He's pushing-- maybe two at most with him on "there, but you know... conservatively saying." (giggles)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My face is covered in spittle. You had other creatures here, too, did you not? Are there larger creatures?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, just them."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh. Didn't we see some larger beasts of burden?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those were other places.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, okay. Okay--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much are we talking for one?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "For one? Well let's see, prices have been going up since they've been buying them off me "left and right for the war parties, so pushing about five hundred gold apiece."

lines.name: LIAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: Oof.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're dangerous, they're quick; faster than any riding horse you've ever seen!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Single saddles, or do you sell custom double saddles?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They can jump thirty feet in a single bounce! Not needing any sort of run up at all!"

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughing) I don't know why I'm trying to drink right now. That's a fucking mistake.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They'll take you there."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (like Zorth) How's the resale value on these? Sorry, sorry! (normal voice) Sorry. How's the resale value if we bought these? Could we sell them in another town for almost as much?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "If you've got a good enough sales plan and you're very convincing, probably. But treat them "well, push them, feed them, don't let them kill and eat you, I think you'll be good."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is this happening in Common?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Is this Goblin or Common?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is Common, because it was a mixed group that came in here. Has not slipped anything Goblin-wise to you directly yet.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a lot. I don't know if we could afford that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How many do you think we would need, do you think? Three, four?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: One, two, three.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They can each hold two, fully grown. What about this big fellow here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "That's what I'm saying! He's probably pushing it to two tops. Maybe three if you're "included. You're also a big one. You're pretty tiny. You'll probably do that, eh?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can get away with three of them, maybe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could probably get away with two.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, no. No, we need three.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Excuse me, my good sir.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yes, of course, what's your name?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Gorth.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Gorth? (laughs) Pleasure to meet you. I'm Zorth. Our names rhyme. That's silly."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That is a coincidence,

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Doesn't happen often."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tickles me belly."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Doesn't seem very remarkable to me. I wanted to ask you: how hard are these creatures to pick up mastering them and riding them? Can you just pick it up or is it a learning curve?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Nah, I'll probably have to give you some sort of seminar when you purchase them. But that's "part of the purchasing price. Get a chance to set you down and we'll go over the basics of "maintenance, and hey, give them a name, get them used to you. Just a few hours of training and I "think we'll be good, yeah?"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: A few hours. But, just maybe one of us per creature, per beast, who knows how to manage it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Preferably, yeah. It needs to bond to one individual. Two, and it might get confusing. And "then it might pick one over the other one day, and then eat the head off of the one it doesn't "decide, you know. If you didn't do it right. So you've got to be careful. (chuckles)"

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, you know, I am good with cats, so this is sounding good to me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Oh, perfect! It's meant to be! How many you buying?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Zorth, you said that fighting forces were coming to take these from you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, they purchased a few. We've been trying to keep up."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're not paying full retail, though, are they?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Here it comes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "They're paying what they are supposed to pay, seeing as how they're keeping us safe from "all the fucking bastards over the Ashkeepers, the way--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And more power to them. I hope they kill those Empire scum, but--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Damn right!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But, I hope, also, that you've been giving them the best of your stock to fight in the front lines.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, all we keep is good stock! I mean, to be honest, the ones that don't grow up perfect "tend to get eaten by the first. So, you know, the ones that survive, they're usually the best stock regardless."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'll switch to Goblin. All right, listen: Goblin to goblin, if we buy three of these, couldn't you cut your fellow gobbie a deal here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So that's 15.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. He goes, "Mmm..."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A one-of-a-kind dick statue.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Leans in close.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And we can't understand! We just see her pull out a dick! (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This was actually a petrified dick.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Really? Of what?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Of a tiny, tiny human, an ancestral human--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That we found in a mine somewhere.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nope. Well, no, it's there. Persuasion?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Deception.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wait, where's that? Ooh, 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (bawdy chuckle)" (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know, right? Humans.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Funny."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You live with that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh. Oh, I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'll tell you what. We can work for trade."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What kind of trade are we talking?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It got a bit scary, so I sealed it off with some chains. And if you'd be interested, maybe you "could go down there and see what's inside, see what the problem is. Maybe

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How much down?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) Free.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're looking to buy how many?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You do this for me, I'll give you all three for 750 gold."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Half price?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Half price."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let me confer with my fellows.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah, of course! Go for it! (chuckles)"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I will convey what was said. What do you guys think? Should we-- oh, shit! Hold on... Hey!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Yeah?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is the monster, or the nest, the place where we would be going, within the confines of this city here, or outside the city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No, it's here beneath the actual premises."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, it's right here? Okay, cool. Back in a few.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sounds unsafe.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did he say what it was?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: What are you talking about?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He wants us to go kill an unknown creature for him, and he'll knock half the price off.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, that's great. Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's still a lot of gold, though.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Two-thirds.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know if we can even get that much gold together.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sure we can.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (theatrically) I don't know if we can, though. We don't have that much gold. Maybe he can knock the price down a little bit more!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How much gold do we have, I don't actually--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We don't have a lot of gold with us, you know? I honestly don't know how much--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know what we should do? We should go down there and take a look at this beast, and we'll decide on the way down.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. Let's go see what's in this cave underneath.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You just want to go?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I was actually going to recommend maybe we can send our tiny, furry friend down there for a little look-see, and then formulate whether or not this is a good deal or not.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, whatever we do, we should do it in the next six-and-a-half minutes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If we all go down into the cav-ay, then maybe you can recast-ay the spell-ay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I did not cast Comprehend Languages; I don't know what that is, but

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm sure if we have a conversation about our individual issues that if anything were to arise while we're in here, I think they seem like an understanding bunch.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know if I have that much coin, but I have some gems and some other items.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, if you don't have any gold to spend, then why are you coming in here asking to buy things?"

lines.name: LAURA, SAM
lines.text: We do have

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Listen, we've decided to go down and take a took, assess the situation, and we'll come back with our verdict. Does that sound good to you?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'd kind of prefer a confirmation. It's up to you."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can agree to do the job right now if you cut the price down to 400 gold total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "No!"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (whispering) 500!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 500 gold total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "650 gold and that's all."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 600 and a tiny dick statue.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, that's good.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 600 and a tiny dick!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Sold!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hold out my leg and say: Shake on it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're fairly dexterous, but it feels like a handshake. The actual foot curves around, gives it a hearty shake, and withdraws back and looks at you all and goes, "So?"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll leave this for collateral.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He plucks it between the two toes and tucks it into a little pocket in the vest in front.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I figure we go down there. If it gets rough, we'll just make an expeditious retreat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it right there, right where you go down, or is it--?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's sort of a-- I'll lead you there."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's awful kind of you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Okay! You ready? All right, come on, follow me!" Turns around, moves behind where the pen was and beyond the door where the goblins were in there. You can see them peeking out as you guys walk by, and they chuckle and giggle behind the door. Getting a closer look at them, they're younger.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Weird question, are they laughing with us, or at us? Are we being taken? Make a what?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Insight check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Insight check. That's good, that could've been so bad. 21.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whispers! Goblin whispers!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: (Liam Neeson accent) Now listen to me very carefully.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Guys, D&D Beyond is not aware that I'm running for president of their organization, but you should subscribe to their service.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You'll follow up on this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I said I don't follow politics. I was talking to Sam.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the far end of this chamber, there's a heavy metal tunnel that curves around the back and that leads from where the pen is-- yeah, there you go-- from the pen reserve, where these creatures are being held and tethered, into another back room. He leads you inside and this is a holding area. The breeding grounds are underneath. They're brought up here and out into the pen as they get older, possibly.
